info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 5:55PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL CLERMONT AND WEST CENTRAL BROWN COUNTIES THROUGH 630 PM EDT... At 554 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near New Richmond, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Georgetown, Amelia, Mount Orab, Bethel, New Richmond, Williamsburg, Felicity, Withamsville, Hamersville, Lindale, Saltair, East Fork State Park, Nicholsville, Point Isabel, Feesburg, Bantam, New Hope, Locust Ridge and Blairsville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for northern Kentucky...and southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
